Event.name: Supporting
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Supporter</fen> assists to strengthen the <fen>Supported</fen> by lending itself in material aid (or abstract assistance in the case of metaphorical uses).
<ex><fex name="Supported">The bottom of the wall</fex> is <t>supported</t> <fex name="Supporter">by the foundation</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Supporter">Many legislators</fex> have <t>supported</t> <fex name="Supported">the industry</fex> <fex name="Time">in the past</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Supporter">The revetment layers</fex> <t>buttressed</t> <fex name="Supported">the mud-mortared cobblestone core wall</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Supporter">Online gambling</fex> can <t>bolster</t> <fex name="Supported">the US economy</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Supporter
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Supporter</fen> acts to benefit the <fex name="Supported">Supported</fex> by providing additional strength or stability.</def-root>

Arg.name: Supported
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Supported</fen> is given strength through the assistance of the <fen>Supporter</fen>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The measure to which the <fen>Supporter</fen>'s assistance brings the <fen>Supported</fen> added strength and support.
<ex>The physical therapist must <fex name="Degree">totally</fex> <t>support</t> tthe patient during the exercises.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Supporter</fen> supports the <fen>Supported</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Duration">For some seventy years</fex>, this judicial fabrication <t>buttressed</t> racial segregation.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Supporter</fen> in service of the <fen>Supported</fen>'s strength by support.
<ex>The troops used <fex name="Instrument">their shoulders</fex> to <t>support</t> the doors of the keep, as the enemy forces tried to break through.</ex>
<ex>For years, patrons of the organization have <t>supported</t> our bi-weekly tea-times <fex name="Instrument">with their generous donations</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which a <fen>Supporter</fen> supports the <fen>Supported</fen>.
<ex>The British Government <fex name="Manner">happily</fex> <t>buttressed</t> Saddam's appalling oppression of his people</ex>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Supporter</fen> undertakes in service of the <fen>Supported</fen>'s strengthening.
<ex>The foundation <t>supports</t> the building <fex name="Means">by distributing the load to the ground below.</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the support occurs.
<ex><fex name="Place">In England</fex>, economic incentives are <t>buttressed</t> by closing certain overdoctored areas from new practices.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies when the support occurs.
<ex><fex name="Time">Early in the twentieth century</fex>, such economic arguments <t>buttressed</t> the creation of a National Park Service.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The situation that the <fen>Supporter</fen> wishes to bring about by supporting the <fen>Supported</fen>.
<ex>The porch tower of Saint-Germain-des-Pr√©s is sturdily <t>buttressed</t> <fex name="Purpose">to support the weight of its massive bells</fex></ex>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state-of-affairs from which the accomplishment would be predicted.</def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>A clause describing the event as a whole.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: support.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to strengthen by bearing the weight of
